title: Lady Gaga had to have almost her whole body X-rayed after falling off stage
text:

Pop sensation Lady Gaga has revealed her fall off stage on Thursday left doctors so worried they X-rayed nearly her whole body for broken bones.

The Born This Way singer, 33, took a tumble after a fan decided to pick her up during the Las Vegas gig.

Gaga took to Instagram to let fans know she's OK, and even made light of the incident.

Sharing a snap of her X-rayed hand making the A-OK sign with her 37.4 million followers, she wrote: "When they have to X-ray almost your entire body..."

Referencing one of her biggest hits, she added: "Just Dance. Gonna be ok."

She had invited a fan up on stage during her performance, but they decided to pick up the singer and dry hump her, at which point they lost their footing and tumbled with Gaga off the stage.

Gaga also stripped off and plunged herself into an ice bath after the fall.

She told fans: "Post show routine: ice bath for 5-10 min, hot bath for 20, then compression suit packed with ice packs for 20."

Gaga can count the almighty Sir Elton John among his fans, as the Rocketman himself recently gushed in an interview with GQ that's she's a true star.

He said: To be a star, you have to be a star for a long time ad you have to do that by being a live performer.

"You can't be a star by just making records."

Later he added: "The only real star at the moment is Lady Gaga. She could have a career like Barbra Streisand if she wanted to. She's got the ambition, she's got talent coming out of every pore of her body, so it's up to her whether she wants it and I think she does want it."
description: The star had to be checked for broken bones following her tumble off a stage in Las Vegas on Thursday
